description: The best way to resolve this problem is to have a tested serum be implemented. Because if the serum is not properly tested before it is put into humans and it does not work, there will be harsh repercussions and panic. The blood of survivors has no real proof that it actually works. The only way to be positive that it is effective is to have a control group that does not receive the blood serum. However, if the blood is what cured the patients then the control group would not survive. If the clinicians could wait to give the serum to control patients to see if their progress is similar to those that do not receive it, and still be able to give them the serum in time to save them if it does work, then that would be ideal.
summary: To give an effective, but tested idea to patients.
title: Stopping Ebola in an efficient, ethical manner
